facts: Basketball was invented in 1891 by James Naismith, a gym teacher in Springfield, Massachusetts.
The first basketball games used a soccer ball and two peach baskets, and someone had to retrieve the ball after each score.
A standard basketball team has five players on the court at one time.
In most leagues, a shot made from behind the three-point line is worth three points instead of two.
The orange basketball became common in the 1950s because it was easier for players and fans to see.
Dribbling became an important skill after rules began allowing players to bounce the ball while moving instead of only passing.
The NBA uses a 24-second shot clock to keep the game moving by requiring a team to attempt a shot in that time.
